documents.document: "America was born of revolt, flourished on dissent, became great through experimentation." - Henry Steele Commager
"All art, all education, can be merely a supplement to nature." - Aristotle
"Everything that irritates us about others can lead us to an understanding of ourselves." - Carl Jung
"You can never solve a problem on the level on which it was created." - Albert Einstein
"The only difference between saints and sinners is that every saint has a past while every sinner has a future." - Oscar Wilde
"You have reached the pinnacle of success as soon as you become uninterested in money, compliments, or publicity." - Thomas Wolfe
"We choose our joys and sorrows long before we experience them." - Henry Kahlil Gibran
"Creativity is allowing yourself to make mistakes. Art is knowing which ones to keep." - Scott Adams
"One can never pay in gratitude; one can only pay 'in kind' somewhere else in life." - Anne Morrow Lindbergh
"Laughter is inner jogging." - Norman Cousins
"Sleep after toil, port after stormy seas, ease after war, death after life does greatly please." - Edmund Spenser
"It is a good thing to be rich, it is a good thing to be strong, but it is a better thing to be beloved of many friends." - Euripides
"You cannot make yourself feel something you do not feel, but you can make yourself do right in spite of your feelings." - Pearl S. Buck
"What you can do, or dream you can do, begin it; boldness has genius, power and magic in it." - Johann von Goethe
"A writer is somebody for whom writing is more difficult than it is for other people." - Thomas Mann
"The true civilization is where every man gives to every other every right that he claims for himself." - Robert Green Ingersoll
"War should be carried on like a monsoon; one changeless determination of every particle towards the one unalterable aim." - Herman Melville
"The heart has reasons that reason does not understand." - Blaise Pascal
"I would rather be exposed to the inconveniences attending too much liberty than to those attending too small a degree of it." - Thomas Jeff
"Kindness is the language which the deaf can hear and the blind can see." - Mark Twain
"It is the customary fate of new truths to begin as heresies and to end as superstitions." - Thomas Henry Huxley
"I will not let anyone walk through my mind with their dirty feet." - Mohandas K. Gandhi
"Worry is interest paid on trouble before it comes due." - William R. Inge
"Nature does nothing uselessly." - Aristotle
"Music hath charms to soothe the savage breast, to soften rocks, or bend a knotted oak." - William Congreve
"The soul is the same in all living creatures, although the body is different." - Hippocrates
"To the mind that is still, the whole universe surrenders." - Lao-Tzu
"In rivers, the water that you touch is the last of what has passed and the 1st of that which comes; so with present time." - Leonardo Vinci
"The goal of life is to make your heartbeat match the beat of the universe, to match your nature with Nature." - Joseph Campbell
"For of all sad words of tongue and pen, the saddest are these: 'It might have been!' " - John Greenleaf Whittier
"It takes courage to grow up and turn out to be who you really are." - E.E. Cummings
"The only real voyage of discovery consists not in seeking new landscapes but in having new eyes." - Marcel Proust
"If only I may grow: firmer, simpler, -- quieter, warmer." - Dag Hammarskjold
"Industry is a better horse to ride than genius." - Walter Lippmann
"Natural abilities are like natural plants; they need pruning by study." - Francis Bacon
"The most wasted of all days is one without laughter." - e.e. cummings
"The instinct of a man is to pursue everything that flies from him, and to fly from all that pursue him." - Voltaire
"We don't understand life any better at forty than at twenty, but we know it and admit it." - Jules Renard
"To be without some of the things you want is an indispensable part of happiness." - Bertrand Russell
"All things are possible until they are proved impossible - and even the impossible may only be so, as of now." - Pearl S. Buck
"It is amazing what you can accomplish if you do not care who gets the credit." - Harry S. Truman
"Chance favors the prepared mind." - Louis Pasteur
"He who has imagination without learning has wings and no feet." - Joseph Joubert
"The most important political office is that of private citizen." - Louis Brandeis
"A great book should leave U with many experiences, & slightly exhausted @ the end. U live several lives while reading it." - William Styron
"The function of the imagination is not to make strange things settled, so much as to make settled things strange." - G.K. Chesterton
"Nurture your mind with great thoughts. To believe in the heroic makes heroes." - Benjamin Disraeli
"Keep thy hook always baited, for a fish lurks ever in the most unlikely swim." - Ovid
"Man acts as though he were the shaper and master of language, while in fact language remains the master of man." - Martin Heidegger
"I'd rather be a failure at something I enjoy than a success at something I hate." - George Burns
"When you reach the top, keep climbing." - Zen proverb
"A closed mind is like a closed book: just a block of wood." - Chinese Proverb
"Obstacles are those frightful things you see when you take your eyes off the goal." - Hannah More
"Do not look where you fell, but where you slipped." - African proverb
"This only grant me, that my means may lie too low for envy, for contempt too high." - Abraham Cowley
"Do what you can, with what you have, where you are." - Theodore Roosevelt
"Success is relative. It is what we can make of the mess we have made of things." - T.S. Eliot
"There are three rules for writing a novel. Unfortunately, no one knows what they are." - William Somerset Maugham
"It is easy to live for others. Everybody does. I call on you to live for yourselves." - Ralph Waldo Emerson
"There is nothing either bad or good, but thinking makes it so." - William Shakespeare
"With willing hearts and skillful hands, the difficult we do at once; the impossible takes a bit longer." - Author unknown
"Stop leaving and you will arrive. Stop searching and you will see. Stop running away and you will be found." - Lao Tzu
"We ought to dance with rapture that we might be alive - and part of the living, incarnate cosmos." - D.H. Lawrence
"Great men are they who see that spiritual is stronger than material force, that thoughts rule the world." - Ralph Waldo Emerson
"Ignorant men don't know what good they hold in their hands until they've flung it away." - Sophocles
"Never cut what you can untie." - Joseph Joubert
"There is nothing worse than a brilliant image of a fuzzy concept." - Ansel Adams
"A belief is not merely an idea the mind possesses; it is an idea that possesses the mind." - Robert Bolton
"Pick battles big enough to matter, small enough to win." - Jonathan Kozol
"Diamonds are nothing more than chunks of coal that stuck to their jobs." - Malcolm Forbes
"Among those whom I like, I can find no common denominator, but among those whom I love, I can; all of them make me laugh." - W H Auden
"Only a person of deep faith can afford the luxury of skepticism." - Friedrich Wilhelm Nietzsche
"Every person takes the limits of their own field of vision for the limits of the world." - Arthur Schopenhauer
"The voyage of discovery is not in seeking new landscapes but in having new eyes." - Marcel Proust
"Much unhappiness has come into this world because of things left unsaid." - Fyodor Dostoevsky
"The worst sin - perhaps the only sin - passion can commit, is to be joyless." - Dorothy L. Sayers
"Make yourself an honest man, and then you may be sure that there is one less scoundrel in the world." - Thomas Carlyle
"Illness is in part what the world has done to a victim, but in a larger part it is what the victim has done with his world." - K. Menninger
"History is a guide to navigation in perilous times. History is who we are and why we are the way we are." - David C McCullough
"I can, therefore I am." - Simone Weil
"Be ashamed to die until you have won some victory for humanity." - Horace Mann
"People change and forget to tell each other." - Lillian Hellman
"The wind cannot shake a mountain. Neither praise nor blame moves a wise man." - Buddha
"To C the world in a grain of sand & heaven in a wildflower hold infinity in the palm of your hand and eternity in an hour."- William Blake
"The world we have created is a product of our thinking. It cannot be changed without changing our thinking." - Albert Einstein
"Great things are not done by impulse, but by a series of small things brought together." - Vincent Van Gogh
"We should often be ashamed of our finest actions if the world understood all the motives behind them." - Francois Duc Ee La Rochefoucauld
"A child becomes an adult when he realizes that he has a right not only to be right but also to be wrong." - Thomas Szasz
"Fear not for the future, weep not for the past." - Percy Bysshe Shelley
"What can we gain by sailing to the moon if we are not able to cross the abyss that separates us from ourselves?" - Thomas Merton
"The greatest human quest is to know what one must do in order to become a human being." - Immanuel Kant
"A bank is a place where they lend you an umbrella in fair weather and ask for it back when it begins to rain." - Robert Frost
"The snow goose need not bathe to make itself white. Neither need you do anything but be yourself." - Lao Tzu
"No man can be called friendless when he has God and the companionship of good books." - Elizabeth Barrett Browning
"We turn, not older with years, but newer every day." - Emily Dickinson
"Ninety-nine percent of all failures come from people who have the habit of making excuses." - George Washington Carver
"If I had my life to live over again, I would have made a rule to read some poetry and listen to some music at least once a week." - Charles
"Television has done much for psychiatry by spreading information about it, as well as contributing to the need for it." - Alfred Hitchcock
"Growing old is no more than a bad habit which a busy man has no time to form." - Andrï¿½ Maurois
"A billion here, a billion there, and pretty soon you?re talking about real money." - Everett McKinley Dirksen
